yogaStyles.name: Hatha Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Hatha yoga is a foundational and traditional form of yoga that focuses on physical postures (asanas) and breath control (pranayama). It is often considered a gentle and introductory style, making it suitable for beginners.

yogaStyles.name: Vinyasa Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Vinyasa, or flow yoga, involves a dynamic sequence of poses that are synchronized with the breath. Movements are smooth and continuous, creating a flowing and meditative practice.

yogaStyles.name: Ashtanga Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Ashtanga is a physically demanding and structured form of yoga that follows a specific sequence of poses. It emphasizes breath control and a set series of postures to build strength, flexibility, and focus.

yogaStyles.name: Iyengar Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Iyengar yoga places a strong emphasis on precision and alignment in the execution of postures. Props like blocks, straps, and blankets are often used to help students achieve correct alignment.

yogaStyles.name: Kundalini Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Kundalini yoga aims to awaken spiritual energy at the base of the spine and channel it upward through the chakras. It involves dynamic movements, breathing exercises, meditation, and chanting.

yogaStyles.name: Bikram Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Bikram yoga, also known as hot yoga, consists of a series of 26 postures and two breathing exercises practiced in a heated room. The heat is believed to enhance flexibility and detoxification.

yogaStyles.name: Jivamukti Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Jivamukti yoga integrates physical postures with spiritual teachings, music, and chanting. Classes often include a theme, and practitioners are encouraged to apply yogic philosophy to daily life.

yogaStyles.name: Restorative Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Restorative yoga focuses on relaxation and rejuvenation, using props to support the body in restful poses. It is ideal for reducing stress and promoting deep relaxation.

yogaStyles.name: Yin Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Yin yoga targets the connective tissues, such as ligaments and fascia, by holding poses for an extended period. It complements more dynamic styles of yoga and enhances flexibility.

yogaStyles.name: Aerial Yoga
yogaStyles.description: Aerial yoga involves performing traditional yoga poses using a hammock or silk suspended from the ceiling. It combines elements of yoga, dance, and acrobatics.

yogaStyles.name: Yoga Nidra
yogaStyles.description: Yoga Nidra, or yogic sleep, is a guided meditation and relaxation practice that induces a state of conscious relaxation. It is often used for stress reduction and deep relaxation.

yogaStyles.name: Flexible Class
yogaStyles.description: Stretch classes typically involve a series of stretching exercises targeting various muscle groups and joints. Static stretches, dynamic stretches, and PNF (proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation) techniques may be incorporated.
